intro: Perrierangraecum longicaule, commonly known as the slender perrierangraecum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
